channel.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer
channel.description:
Horror Wraith (Neutral Killer) - Slow Burn Neutral Killer.
Day Ability 1: Horror Mark. Unlimited use.
Mark a target with an Eldritch horror. This will kill the person in three days. [Horror mark someone day 1, they die day 4.]
The target isn't made aware that they've been marked [No system message]. Instead, a shadowy nightmare can be found in their rooms / in the court for them alone. As the day of their death grows closer, the figure gets more noticeable. Only those aware of their surroundings and paying attention will notice the horror mark, and be able to alert others to it's presence. The only way to remove the horror mark is to kill the Neutral Killer.
[For example, First room horror mark will be nothing more than a small shadow in the court. Hard to see unless paying attention. Day two, more noticeable. Features and the room are morphed. Day immediately before death, the entire room is twisted [Like a nightmare version.] and impossible to ignore / miss.]
Day Ability 2 (Optional): Terrify. Two uses.
Select a target that has been horror marked. This target is struck by terror [system message or visual queue], losing their ability to speak and having their horror mark advanced to the final stage [So they will die the next day]. This also prevents them from voting, accusing and using abilities.
Night Ability 1: Mimicry. Unlimited uses.
Anyone using investigative skills on you tonight will instead get the references of a horror marked player of your choice. [Example; If you have a Princess and an assassin horror marked, you can choose the Princess and show up as Special / Inves and BD that night, or the assassin and show up as Killer / Offensive and Unseen.]
Night Ability 2: Unleash Horrors [Night 3 and after]. Two uses.
Everyone visiting the Neutral Killer, or one of his Horror Marked, is exposed to the horrors and thus marked themselves, as if they had been marked the prior day during court.
Passive: Unending Horror
Immune to [s]occupation and[/s] death.
Passive 2: All Seeing.
The Neutral Killer gains 'vision' through his horror marks. As such, he can see the marked ones classes besides their names on the list. [Such as when a player is dead. Except they're not dead. Yet.]
Comments: I ran this by my chat during a stream. The basic concept was a slow burn neutral killer, that grew from my initial idea of a need to look around the environment for clues and information. Also horror is cool as fuck and this idea is baller to me, in theory.

item.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
explain what it looks like, because the court almost always looks the same so I think a change would be obvious

item.dc:creator: Dadmos
item.description:
No no. The first day is incredibly hard. The second day, somewhat easier. The third and final day [Since you’re dead the next] would be blindingly obvious.

item.description:

Read full topic

item.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
the whole “you have to notice it” when it is something pretty easy to see is a bad idea

Read full topic

item.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer
item.dc:creator: Dadmos
item.description:
Ashe:

people would always be looking for the mark every day/night to make sure they don’t miss it

The same can be said for a lot of games. But in a game with such a restrictive time to work with like TOL, even sacrificing as little as ten seconds to look for a horror mark can be a huge thing. Thats enough time for people to bus you, for a claim to be missed, for chat to push pass a poison message, etc.

Ashe:

I think a good compromise would be to have it give a system message on day 2 or 3 of the effect

I can agree with this. One on day three, when it should be impossible for you to miss it, since the idea is you’re now dead, unless the horror wraith dies that day or night.

Read full topic

item.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer
item.dc:creator: Okx
item.description:
poor alchemists

Read full topic

item.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer
item.dc:creator: Ashe
item.description:
I hate to say it because in a perfect world abilities like Horror Mark would be really cool, but in reality they don’t work in their “you don’t know about it” way. The thing is, people would always be looking for the mark every day/night to make sure they don’t miss it, or worse yet fiddling with brightness or other settings to help look for the mark, defeating the purpose of having subtle changes. I think a good compromise would be to have it give a system message on day 2 or 3 of the effect, so you still get the effect of people not knowing immediately, but now it wouldn’t be possible to abuse and is the same for everyone (because a visual mechanic also has the downside of being harder to see for the visually impaired too, which creates another imbalance).

Read full topic

item.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer
item.dc:creator: Marluxion
item.description:
10/10. I’m not too sure about the second night ability (maybe something a tad more simple like a standard attacking ability with a twist). But everything else especially the day ability is so damn clever.

Read full topic

I have a P2 Nurse, P3 Lvl 50 Claudette that has S.F and all Teachable perks (except for crappy ones and Quintens ones), P2 Meg and the list goes on

I stopped playing the game a while ago though.
If your new to the game I can carry you

(or at least attempt to)

item.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer
item.dc:creator: Dadmos
item.description:
It’s difficult for a NK to get away with killer / off with the current state of the game [Re; Knight being the only non-occupy immune Kill / Off.], although if he’s good enough to get away with claiming another at the right time, he should be gucci.

But taking this into advisement, I edited the post accordingly.

Read full topic

item.title: Horror Wraith - Neutral Killer

item.description:
Agreed, it’s a slow burn NK with it’s killing powers used during the day, I’d lose the occupy immunity so you are less suspicious, considering you don’t need your night powers as much.
